alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 6:24PM MDT until August 19 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated prior thunderstorms produced heavy rain across western portions of Zion National Park, particularly through Parunuweap Canyon, Pine Creek, Lower Clear Creek, Spry Canyon, and Keyhole Canyon. Approximately 0.50 and 1.25 inches of rain had fallen. Zion Dispatch reported multiple small waterfalls throughout the park, and the East Fork Virgin River Gage near Springdale recorded a rapid streamflow increase peaking near 800 CFS. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area with showers and thunderstorms moving over the park. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, slot canyons, and typically dry washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park and Springdale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
